00022 /**
00023  * @file   ClusterZ.h
00024  * @author Earl Hubbell
00025  * @date   Wed Aug 2 2006
00026  * 
00027 * Strip out the clustering classes from the genotyping routines
00028 * to avoid potential redundancy
00029 * i.e. pretend we have a genotyping SDK
00030  * * 
00031  */
00032 
00033 #ifndef CLUSTERZ_H 
00034 #define CLUSTERZ_H
00035

00037 #include "chipstream/BioTypes.h"
00038 #include "chipstream/ProbeSet.h"

00040 #include "stats/stats.h"

00044 #include <cfloat>

00046 #include <string>
00047 #include <vector>

00049 
00050 /*
00051  * this class contains cluster prior data for BRLMM-style clusters
00052  */
00053 class ClusterPrior {
00054 
00055 public: 
00056   std::string id;
00057   unsigned int snpCount;
00058   ColumnVector centers;
00059   ColumnVector centerVars;
00060   Matrix covars;
00061   ClusterPrior() : snpCount(0) {}
00062 };
00063 
00064 /*
00065  * this class contains cluster "model" data for BRLMM-style clusters
00066  */
00067 class ClusterModel {
00068 
00069 public:
00070   Matrix clusterMeans;
00071   Matrix clusterVars;
00072 };
00073 
00074 /*
00075  * this class contains summary data for clusters
00076  */
00077 class ClusterStats {
00078 
00079 public:
00080 
00081   /* Set all our counts to three for the three possible genotypes:
00082      AA,AB,BB */
00083   ClusterStats();
00084 
00085   // counts an means should usually have 3 observations each one eache
00086   // for AA, AB, and BB respectively. Check these to make sure they are
00087   // at least two, otherwise the variance calculations are invalid.
00088   std::vector<int> counts;   ///< How many of each type of SNP genotype were observed.
00089   
00090   // These next two vectors keep track of values for genotyping equivalent of MA plots in
00091   // R, essentially A is the difference and M is a measure of joint intensity 
00092   std::vector<double> mMeans; ///< Mean M (intensity) of each genotype (center of the clusters);
00093   std::vector<double> aMeans; ///< Mean A (difference) of each genotype (center of the clusters);
00094   std::vector<double> mVars;
00095   std::vector<double> aVars;
00096   std::vector<double> covars;
00097   /// Simon style vars object, not sure why indexed like this but it
00098   /// goes:
00099   /// mVars[0],aVars[0],covars[0],mVars[1],aVars[1],covars[1],etc..
00100   std::vector<double> vars; 
00101   /// Simon style means object, not sure why indexed like this but it
00102   /// goes:
00103   /// mMeans[0],aMeans[0],mMeans[1],aMeans[1],etc..
00104   std::vector<double> means;
00105 };
